div.head:
4108. Robert Southey to Sir Thomas [Dyke Acland], 26 December 1823 Watermark: 1823
MS: Department of Rare Books, Special Collections and Preservation, River Campus Libraries, University of Rochester, Robert Southey Papers A.S727. ALS; 2p.
Unpublished.
div.p: In xxx reply to your obliging letter (which I find on my return to town) I can promise (Deo volente)‘God willing’. to be with you Monday the 12th instead of going from Crediton to Taunton on that day. I must advance on my circuit the next, –
Had you been at Porlock about the 15th I might possibly have looked for you there.
With the good old English wish at this good season, that you & yours may enjoy it now, & witness many happy returns of it, believe me to remain
